p.s: The excerpt at hand is a passage from the sixth chapter in the second part of the novel The Tortilla Curtain written by T. C. Boyle.
The novel deals with the hardships in daily life and the fight for survival of two undocumented Mexicans that have escaped to the US.
While the whole neighborhood is planning to construct a wall around their so far gated community, a man called Todd Sweet is trying to convince his neighbors of the opposite.
Here his conversation with Delaney, one of the two antagonists living in the community in question, is finished and Delaney makes his way back home.

On his way he notices a man crossing his neighbors' lawn who turns out to be José Navidad, a Mexican who he's already encountered while hiking and his wife Kyra, has told him about being threatened by.
Delaney confronts him by asking what he's doing in their community and assumes he's up to comitting crime.

After not responding for a while, and being physically approached by Delaney, José assures that he's delivering fliers that are supposed to invite the inhabitants to a meeting in order to discuss the wall-issue.
